seo.title: Hailuo 02 (512p/768p) — 6–10s Draft Text-to-Video
seo.description: Create low-cost Hailuo 02 draft clips at 512p/768p from text (or images). 6–10s silent videos for storyboards and motion tests—then upgrade winners to Veo/Kling/Wan/Sora in MaxVideoAI.

overview: MiniMax Hailuo 02 in MaxVideoAI: short, cheap, physics-aware clips at 512p/768p in 6 or 10 seconds. Text or image input, optional end frame, silent output, and wallet-based pricing for rapid drafts and loops.

hero.title: MiniMax Hailuo 02 – Budget AI Video Drafts with Strong Physics
hero.intro: Silent 6–10s draft clips at 512p/768p — physics-aware motion tests, camera experiments, and fast iteration.
hero.badge: 512p/768p · 6–10s · Text or Image input · Silent output

technicalOverview.label: Inputs
technicalOverview.body: Text prompts; optional reference image; optional end frame

technicalOverview.label: Audio
technicalOverview.body: Silent output (no native or uploaded audio)

technicalOverview.label: Pricing
technicalOverview.body: Budget-friendly; wallet-based live pricing in Generate

promptStructure.title: Text-to-Video with MiniMax Hailuo 02
promptStructure.quote: [Duration] second [aspect ratio] shot of [subject] moving through [environment]. Camera [movement] while [secondary motion] reacts naturally (wind/fur/debris). Style: [realistic/stylized]. No text or logos.
promptStructure.description: Keep prompts short and motion-forward: subject in motion, environment, camera, physics, style, and a negative prompt.
steps: Aspect & duration (6 or 10 s) plus negative prompt

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: Use 1–3 sentences; overlong prompts can introduce artifacts
One main subject/environment/effect per clip for clarity
Upload reference + end frame to lock composition and landing
512p for fastest/cheapest drafts; 768p for social-ready output
Plan to add audio in post or pair with Wan/Sora/Veo clips

prompts.title: Windy rooftop drift (10s, 16:9)
prompts.prompt: 10s 16:9 glide across a stylized city rooftop at night; coat and hair react to gusts, camera floats past neon signs, puddle reflections, no text/logos/UI.

prompts.title: Fox sprint physics sketch (6s, 16:9)
prompts.prompt: 6s 16:9 shot of a red fox sprinting through a dense forest on a windy day. Camera follows low behind; leaves/dust swirl; realistic fur motion; stylized colors; no text/logos.

faqs.q: Why choose MiniMax over premium engines?
faqs.a: Great motion/physics at lower per-second cost, ideal for volume ads, explainers and experiments without burning budget.
2–3 sentences covering subject, environment, camera and physics; one main idea per clip.
No. Hailuo 02 outputs silent video; add sound in post or pair with audio-capable engines.
Use Hailuo 02 for drafts at 512p/768p, then upscale or rerun the prompt in higher-resolution engines (Veo, Kling, Wan, Sora 2 Pro).

custom.heroDesc1: Generate fast, physics-aware drafts at 512p/768p from text or a single image, with optional end frame to lock the landing.
custom.heroDesc2: Pick 6 or 10 seconds, choose 16:9/9:16/1:1, and get silent clips ready for storyboards, loops and motion tests.
custom.heroSupportLine: Best when you want to explore movement and transitions cheaply before rebuilding the keepers in premium engines.
heroHighlights: Extreme physics cues||Wind, cloth, particles, and inertia read surprisingly well for quick tests.
End-frame control||Add a target last frame to steer how the shot lands.
Built for volume||Great when you need lots of variants without burning budget.
Silent drafts||Easy to score in post (or pair with an audio-capable engine for finals).
custom.whatTitle: What MiniMax Hailuo 02 Actually Is in MaxVideoAI
custom.whatIntro1: MiniMax’s headline model for short sequences with strong physics and prompt adherence.
custom.whatIntro2: In MaxVideoAI it’s wired as a fast, silent draft engine at 512p/768p.
whatFlowSteps: 2. Select Text → Video or Image → Video.
3. Pick 6 or 10 seconds, resolution (512p/768p) and aspect ratio.
4. Optionally upload a reference image and/or end frame.
5. Paste a short, motion-focused prompt (add physics if needed).
custom.specTitle: Real Specs – MiniMax Hailuo 02 in MaxVideoAI (512p/768p, 6–10s)
custom.specNote: Specs as used today in MaxVideoAI.

specSections.title: Physics-heavy drafts
specSections.intro: Strong at physical motion like wind, cloth, and particles. Ideal for motion tests and transition exploration.
items: Call out wind or force direction.
Use simple scenes for readable motion.

specSections.title: End-frame control
specSections.intro: You can guide how a shot lands by defining a target end frame. Useful for match cuts and clean finishes.
items: Use as a bridge between two shots.
Pair with premium engines for finals.

custom.specValueProp: MiniMax Hailuo 02 is a fast, physics-savvy draft engine for cheap, silent motion tests.
custom.galleryIntro: See text and image runs rendered with the same configuration you have.
custom.imageTitle: Image-to-Video with MiniMax Hailuo 02 (+ End Frames)
custom.imageIntro: Animate boards/renders/concepts quickly with optional end frame.
imageFlow: Prompt for camera + physics; specify landing on the end frame.
imageWhy: Looping backgrounds for streams or hero sections
custom.multishotIntro1: 6s: 1–2 beats; 10s: 2–3 beats max in one environment.
custom.multishotIntro2: Focus on physics-driven transitions in a single setting.
multishotTips: Beat 1: establish; Beat 2: motion/transition; Beat 3: hero frame
Keep to one environment/style per clip
strengths: Physics-first prompts: call out force direction + material response (wind/cloth/particles/inertia/contact) instead of long style lists.
Use bracketed camera moves ([pan], [tilt], [push in]) and keep it to one move per clip.
Keep scenes simple so motion reads (one hero subject, one clear action).
Use First/Last frame when you need a clean landing (match cuts, transforms, start→end transitions).
Generate multiple variants fast; pick the best motion, then rebuild finals in a higher-fidelity engine.
boundaries: 6s or 10s per render in this routing.
Silent output — add sound in post.
Tiny on-screen text is unreliable — overlay critical copy in post.
safetyRules: No sexual content, and nothing involving minors.
No hateful, harassing, or graphic-violence content.
Don’t impersonate real people or public figures; use consent for any likeness.
Don’t include private personal data (addresses, phone numbers, documents, non-consenting faces).
Use only content you have rights to (images/brands/IP); some prompts/inputs may be blocked by provider safety filters.

Short, motion-forward: subject, environment, camera, physics; one idea per clip.
No. Outputs are silent; add sound in post or via audio engines.
Draft in Hailuo 02 (512p/768p), then upscale or rerun in higher-resolution engines like Veo/Kling/Wan/Sora 2 Pro.

custom.promptingTitle: How to Write a Great Hailuo 02 Prompt
custom.promptingIntro: Hailuo 02 works best with short prompts and explicit motion cues.
custom.promptingTip: Tip: duration + aspect ratio are set in the UI - your prompt controls subject, action, camera, lighting, and style. Use bracketed camera moves like [pan], [tilt], [zoom].
promptingGlobalPrinciples: Use an end frame (optional) to land the transition.
custom.tipsIntro: Hailuo 02 is a draft-tier physics engine: use it for motion tests, transition experiments, and landing clean end frames.
promptingEngineWhy: Prompt optimizer can expand short prompts.
End frame improves landing and match cuts.

promptingTabNotes.quick: Quick = variations. Use for fast iteration.
promptingTabNotes.structured: Structured = consistency. Use when you need reliable results.
promptingTabNotes.pro: Pro = style control. Use for precise, repeatable looks.

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1–2 sentences when you want variations.

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Subject:
[Who/what + one action.]

Scene:
[Location + time + 2 anchors.]

Camera:
[Shot + angle + motion in brackets, e.g., [pan left], [zoom in].]

Look:
[Lighting + palette + style.]

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "studio brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific look or continuity across shots.
promptingTabs.copy:
Brief:
[Goal + vibe.]

Subject + setting:
[Key traits + location + anchors.]

Camera + motion:
[Framing + bracketed motion cue.]

Optional end frame:
[Describe the target last frame if using one.]

Lighting + style:
[Key light + palette.]

demoPrompt: 10s vertical shot on a neon street at night, stylized but grounded physics.
Camera floats above puddles, rippling reflections; passersby and umbrellas in soft blur.
Wind gusts move trash and steam; slightly painterly look, saturated colors, no text/logos.
demoNotes: Easy to loop as a background.
Silent output ready for your soundtrack.
troubleshootingItems: Motion feels floaty → add weight/contact cues (“grounded”, “friction”, “objects don’t slide”), slow the action, reduce camera shake.
Drift / changes mid-clip → reduce props and secondary characters; repeat the same subject + wardrobe + lighting anchors.
End frame doesn’t land → describe the final pose/composition explicitly; remove extra actions near the end.
Jittery camera → specify “tripod-stable” or “smooth track”; avoid “dynamic” wording.
Random text/logos → add a short negative (“no text, no logos, no UI”) and keep signage out of frame.
